title: 105_hr231
content: Protecting the integrity of the Social Security Account Number card is essential. Improvements to the physical design, technical specifications, and materials of the social security account number card are necessary to enhance security against counterfeiting, forgery, alteration, and misuse, comparable to the 100 dollar Federal Reserve note. Beginning January 1, 2000, all social security account number cards issued must be secure against fraudulent use, similar to a United States passport. Starting January 1, 2006, a secured social security account number card can be used for employment verification. The section outlines that the secured social security card is not a national identification card, prohibits the establishment of new databases, mandates an education campaign for employers on card security features, and requires annual reports on the progress of developing the secured card. The section discusses the progress in developing a secured social security card, addressing counterfeit production and fraud prevention. The Comptroller General conducts annual audits on the Social Security Administration's performance in meeting these requirements. Any additional costs incurred for the cards are not to be paid from the Trust Fund, and necessary funds are authorized to be appropriated. Authorized to appropriate necessary funds for this section. SEC. 2. Criminal penalties for fraud and related activity with work authorization documents. Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include work authorization documents in the definition of false identification documents. Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include work authorization documents in the definition of false identification documents, with specific changes to paragraphs (4), (5), and (6) regarding the use of false identification or work authorization documents. Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include work authorization documents as false identification documents. Changes are made to specify the inclusion of work authorization documents in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of the definition. The amendment to Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code includes work authorization documents as false identification documents. The changes specify the inclusion of work authorization documents in various subsections by replacing "identification document" with "identification document, false identification document, work authorization document, or false work authorization document." The amendment to Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code expands the definition of false identification documents to include work authorization documents. This change is reflected in various subsections by adding "work authorization document" alongside "false identification document." The item relating to section 1028 in the table of sections at the beginning of chapter 47 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include work authorization documents. Fraud and related activity in connection with identification and work authorization documents.
